channel.title: 1 on Abraham P. Vinod
channel.description: Recent content in 1 on Abraham P. Vinod

item.title: Multiple Pursuer-Based Intercept Via Forward Stochastic Reachability
Scalable Underapproximative Verification of Stochastic LTI Systems Using Convexity and Compactness
item.description: This paper was a finalist for the HSCC 2018 best paper award. The main contributions of this paper was: Sufficient conditions for the convexity and compactness of the stochastic reach-avoid sets (set of safe1 initial states for stochastic systems under bounded control authority) for LTI systems Tractable and scalable polytopic underapproximation by utilizing the “oracle” discussed in CSSL 2017 paper Sufficient conditions for bang-bang safe policies. Safety is defined as being able to reach a target set at the time horizon and stay within the safe set during the rest of the time horizon.

item.title: Underapproximation of Reach-Avoid Sets for Discrete-Time Stochastic Systems via Lagrangian Methods
Computation of forward stochastic reach sets: Application to stochastic, dynamic obstacle avoidance
Dynamic risk tolerance: Motion planning by balancing short-term and long-term stochastic dynamic predictions
Forward Stochastic Reachability Analysis for Uncontrolled Linear Systems using Fourier Transforms
Viable set approximation for linear-Gaussian systems with unknown, bounded variance
Validation of cognitive models for collaborative hybrid systems with discrete human input
User-interface design for MIMO LTI human-automation systems through sensor placement
